metadata.title: Convert Celsius to Rankine – Temperature Converter
metadata.description: Convert temperature from Celsius (°C) to Rankine (°R), used in thermodynamics and engineering calculations.

introduction: This converter transforms temperature from Celsius to Rankine, essential for thermodynamic calculations and engineering applications.
Rankine is an absolute temperature scale like Kelvin, but uses Fahrenheit degree intervals. It's used in American engineering and some thermodynamics work.
This converter uses the relationship where °R = (°C + 273.15) × 9/5.
methodology: Rankine is an absolute temperature scale (no negative values). Zero Rankine equals absolute zero (-273.15°C).
To convert Celsius to Rankine: °R = (°C + 273.15) × 1.8. This combines the Celsius-to-Kelvin shift with the Celsius-to-Fahrenheit scale conversion.
Engineering thermodynamics often uses Rankine because it maintains Fahrenheit degree size while providing absolute zero reference.
This converter provides precise temperature conversions for engineering and scientific applications.

faqs.question: What is the conversion from Celsius to Rankine?
Why use Rankine instead of Kelvin?
faqs.answer: Rankine uses Fahrenheit-sized degrees while being absolute. American engineers often prefer Rankine for consistency.

faqs.question: What is absolute zero in Rankine?
faqs.answer: 0°R is absolute zero (-273.15°C, -459.67°F). No temperature can be lower.

glossary.definition: Temperature scale where water freezes at 0° and boils at 100°.
Absolute temperature scale using Fahrenheit degree intervals.
